column1: This is a complete list of the 2
column2: 054 cities and towns in Germany (as of 1 January 2020). There is no distinction between town and city in Germany; a Stadt is an independent municipality (see Municipalities of Germany) that has been given the right to use that title. In contrast
column3: the generally smaller German municipalities that don't use this title
column4: and are thus not included here
column5: are usually just called Gemeinden. Historically
column6: the title Stadt was associated with town privileges
column7: but today it is a mere honorific title. The title can be bestowed to a municipality by its respective state government and is generally given to such municipalities that have either had historic town rights or have attained considerable size and importance more recently. Towns with over 100
column9: a statistical notion sometimes translated as "city"
column10: but having no effect on their administrative status. In this list
column11: only the cities' and towns' names are given. For more restricted lists with more details
